questions.text: The Francis Scott Key key was the name of the key Amy told Mrs. Marion Cotesworth-Haye that she would be receiving from Abbey.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Will helped her name the award by holding out a key and the United States flag.

Abbey & Abby & Abigail.

	Amy and Abbey discussed it during the DAR reception.

questions.text: What did Will find in his coat pocket?
questions.explanation:
Olives.

	Will thought they were through with the hazing until he stuck his hand in his pockets and retrieved the olives.

questions.text: Amelia is Amy's full first name.
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Abbey addressed her with the name while they were talking.

questions.text: What branch of armed services were the men from that rigged Amy's office?
questions.explanation:
Army.

	They were from Army Counter Intelligence and Josh didn't ask them any questions about how they rigged her walls and doors.

questions.text: Who got the giggles during the meeting with Mrs. Cotesworth-Haye?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	CJ got the giggles over the woman's name and couldn't talk throughout the majority of the meeting.

questions.text: Did Amy keep the former Chief of Staff's assistant?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	The former Chief of Staff was Abbey's nephew, Max, and the assistant's name was Nat. Amy told him they would try it out.

questions.text: Which fell first in Amy's office: the doors or the pictures?
options: They fell at the same time
questions.explanation:
The pictures.

	The pictures fell from the walls twice and the doors fell right after the first lady had left Amy's office.

questions.text: Which newspaper called Will about the privateer on Abbey's side of the family?
questions.explanation:
'Boston Globe'.

	Will had no idea about the privateer in Mrs. Bartlet's family tree so Josh put him together with CJ so she could talk to him about it.

questions.text: Who said they don't have launch sequence codes?
questions.explanation:
Amy.

	Amy said she didn't have launch sequence codes out in the public area of The White House when Josh kept her from talking. So in front of several guards Josh had to quickly say, "She really doesn't. She's fine."
